alert.note: Alert for Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 16 at 2:22PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Elbert County through 300 PM MDT... At 219 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 8 miles northwest of Ramah, or 29 miles west of Limon, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts possible, winds in excess of 40 mph, and half inch hail. Expect very heavy rain with minor flooding of creeks and low lying areas. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Landspout tornadoes can damage mobile homes, roofs, vehicles, and trees. Outdoor objects may be tossed about. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Elbert, Kiowa and Simla. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 900 PM MDT for east central Colorado.

area.areaDesc: Elbert, Central and East Douglas Counties Above 6000 Feet; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County
